author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Wednesday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to expedite the announcement about the location of a branch of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Tamil Nadu.

In a letter to Prime Minister, a copy of which was released to the media here, Ms Jayalalithaa said even 9 months after a Central team visited the State and inspected five locations, the Centre has not yet announced the site where the institute would be constructed.

The project would provide state-of-the-art medical facilities and services to the people of Tamil Nadu.

“I request you to expedite the announcement of location of the AIIMS in Tamil Nadu and to ensure that the construction and establishment of AIIMS is initiated without any further delay,” she said.

‘A budget promise’

Following an announcement in the Union Budget 2014-15 that an AIIMS would be established in different places in the country, Ms. Jayalalithaa had written to the Prime Minister requesting that one such Institute should be established in the State.
title: Announce AIIMS site soon, CM urges Modi
